io.appium.droiddriver.finders

Class ChainFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.appium.droiddriver.finders.ChainFinder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Finder

    public class ChainFinder
extends java.lang.Object
implements Finder
    Finds UiElement by applying Finders in turn: using the UiElement returned by first Finder as context for the second Finder. It is conceptually similar to Function composition. The returned UiElement can be thought of as the result of second(first(context)).

    Note typically first Finder finds the ancestor, then second Finder finds the target UiElement, which is a descendant. ChainFinder can be chained with additional Finders to make a "chain".

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from interface: Finder

        It is recommended that this method return the description of the finder, for example, "{text=OK}".

        Specified by:

      • find

        public UiElement find(UiElement context)
        Description copied from interface: Finder
        Returns the matching UiElement. The implementing finder should not poll.

        Invisible UiElements are skipped.

        Specified by:
        find in interface Finder
        Parameters:
        context - The starting UiElement, used as search context
        Returns:
        The first matching element on the current context
